00027 #include "socklnd.h"
00028 
00029 /*
00030  * Protocol entries :
00031  *   pro_send_hello       : send hello message
00032  *   pro_recv_hello       : receive hello message
00033  *   pro_pack             : pack message header
00034  *   pro_unpack           : unpack message header
00035  *   pro_queue_tx_zcack() : Called holding BH lock: kss_lock
00036  *                          return 1 if ACK is piggybacked, otherwise return 0
00037  *   pro_queue_tx_msg()   : Called holding BH lock: kss_lock
00038  *                          return the ACK that piggybacked by my message, or NULL
00039  *   pro_handle_zcreq()   : handler of incoming ZC-REQ
00040  *   pro_handle_zcack()   : handler of incoming ZC-ACK
00041  *   pro_match_tx()       : Called holding glock
00042  */
00043 
00044 static ksock_tx_t *
00045 ksocknal_queue_tx_msg_v1(ksock_conn_t *conn, ksock_tx_t *tx_msg)
00046 {
00047         /* V1.x, just enqueue it */
00048         list_add_tail(&tx_msg->tx_list, &conn->ksnc_tx_queue);
00049         return NULL;
00050 }
00051 
00052 void
00053 ksocknal_next_tx_carrier(ksock_conn_t *conn)
00054 {
00055         ksock_tx_t     *tx = conn->ksnc_tx_carrier;
00056 
00057         /* Called holding BH lock: conn->ksnc_scheduler->kss_lock */
00058         LASSERT(!list_empty(&conn->ksnc_tx_queue));
00059         LASSERT(tx != NULL);
00060 
00061         /* Next TX that can carry ZC-ACK or LNet message */
00062         if (tx->tx_list.next == &conn->ksnc_tx_queue) {
00063                 /* no more packets queued */
00064                 conn->ksnc_tx_carrier = NULL;
00065         } else {
00066                 conn->ksnc_tx_carrier = list_entry(tx->tx_list.next,
00067                                                        ksock_tx_t, tx_list);
00068                 LASSERT(conn->ksnc_tx_carrier->tx_msg.ksm_type ==
00069                         tx->tx_msg.ksm_type);
00070         }
00071 }
00072 
00073 static int
00074 ksocknal_queue_tx_zcack_v2(ksock_conn_t *conn,
00075                            ksock_tx_t *tx_ack, __u64 cookie)
00076 {
00077         ksock_tx_t *tx = conn->ksnc_tx_carrier;
00078 
00079         LASSERT (tx_ack == NULL ||
00080                  tx_ack->tx_msg.ksm_type == KSOCK_MSG_NOOP);
00081 
00082         /*
00083          * Enqueue or piggyback tx_ack / cookie
00084          * . no tx can piggyback cookie of tx_ack (or cookie), just
00085          *   enqueue the tx_ack (if tx_ack != NUL) and return NULL.
00086          * . There is tx can piggyback cookie of tx_ack (or cookie),
00087          *   piggyback the cookie and return the tx.
00088          */
00089         if (tx == NULL) {
00090                 if (tx_ack != NULL) {
00091                         list_add_tail(&tx_ack->tx_list,
00092                                           &conn->ksnc_tx_queue);
00093                         conn->ksnc_tx_carrier = tx_ack;
00094                 }
00095                 return 0;
00096         }
00097 
00098         if (tx->tx_msg.ksm_type == KSOCK_MSG_NOOP) {
00099                 /* tx is noop zc-ack, can't piggyback zc-ack cookie */
00100                 if (tx_ack != NULL)
00101                         list_add_tail(&tx_ack->tx_list,
00102                                           &conn->ksnc_tx_queue);
00103                 return 0;
00104         }
00105 
00106         LASSERT(tx->tx_msg.ksm_type == KSOCK_MSG_LNET);
00107         LASSERT(tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] == 0);
00108 
00109         if (tx_ack != NULL)
00110                 cookie = tx_ack->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1];
00111 
00112         /* piggyback the zc-ack cookie */
00113         tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] = cookie;
00114         /* move on to the next TX which can carry cookie */
00115         ksocknal_next_tx_carrier(conn);
00116 
00117         return 1;
00118 }
00119 
00120 static ksock_tx_t *
00121 ksocknal_queue_tx_msg_v2(ksock_conn_t *conn, ksock_tx_t *tx_msg)
00122 {
00123         ksock_tx_t  *tx  = conn->ksnc_tx_carrier;
00124 
00125         /*
00126          * Enqueue tx_msg:
00127          * . If there is no NOOP on the connection, just enqueue
00128          *   tx_msg and return NULL
00129          * . If there is NOOP on the connection, piggyback the cookie
00130          *   and replace the NOOP tx, and return the NOOP tx.
00131          */
00132         if (tx == NULL) { /* nothing on queue */
00133                 list_add_tail(&tx_msg->tx_list, &conn->ksnc_tx_queue);
00134                 conn->ksnc_tx_carrier = tx_msg;
00135                 return NULL;
00136         }
00137 
00138         if (tx->tx_msg.ksm_type == KSOCK_MSG_LNET) { /* nothing to carry */
00139                 list_add_tail(&tx_msg->tx_list, &conn->ksnc_tx_queue);
00140                 return NULL;
00141         }
00142 
00143         LASSERT (tx->tx_msg.ksm_type == KSOCK_MSG_NOOP);
00144 
00145         /* There is a noop zc-ack can be piggybacked */
00146         tx_msg->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] = tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1];
00147         ksocknal_next_tx_carrier(conn);
00148 
00149         /* use new_tx to replace the noop zc-ack packet */
00150         list_add(&tx_msg->tx_list, &tx->tx_list);
00151         list_del(&tx->tx_list);
00152 
00153         return tx;
00154 }
00155 
00156 static int
00157 ksocknal_queue_tx_zcack_v3(ksock_conn_t *conn,
00158                            ksock_tx_t *tx_ack, __u64 cookie)
00159 {
00160         ksock_tx_t *tx;
00161 
00162         if (conn->ksnc_type != SOCKLND_CONN_ACK)
00163                 return ksocknal_queue_tx_zcack_v2(conn, tx_ack, cookie);
00164 
00165         /* non-blocking ZC-ACK (to router) */
00166         LASSERT (tx_ack == NULL ||
00167                  tx_ack->tx_msg.ksm_type == KSOCK_MSG_NOOP);
00168 
00169         if ((tx = conn->ksnc_tx_carrier) == NULL) {
00170                 if (tx_ack != NULL) {
00171                         list_add_tail(&tx_ack->tx_list,
00172                                           &conn->ksnc_tx_queue);
00173                         conn->ksnc_tx_carrier = tx_ack;
00174                 }
00175                 return 0;
00176         }
00177 
00178         /* conn->ksnc_tx_carrier != NULL */
00179 
00180         if (tx_ack != NULL)
00181                 cookie = tx_ack->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1];
00182 
00183         if (cookie == SOCKNAL_KEEPALIVE_PING) /* ignore keepalive PING */
00184                 return 1;
00185 
00186         if (tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] == SOCKNAL_KEEPALIVE_PING) {
00187                 /* replace the keepalive PING with a real ACK */
00188                 LASSERT (tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] == 0);
00189                 tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] = cookie;
00190                 return 1;
00191         }
00192 
00193         if (cookie == tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] ||
00194             cookie == tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1]) {
00195                 CWARN("%s: duplicated ZC cookie: "LPU64"\n",
00196                       libcfs_id2str(conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id), cookie);
00197                 return 1; /* XXX return error in the future */
00198         }
00199 
00200         if (tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] == 0) {
00201                 /* NOOP tx has only one ZC-ACK cookie, can carry at least one more */
00202                 if (tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] > cookie) {
00203                         tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] = tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1];
00204                         tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] = cookie;
00205                 } else {
00206                         tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] = cookie;
00207                 }
00208 
00209                 if (tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] - tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] > 2) {
00210                         /* not likely to carry more ACKs, skip it to simplify logic */
00211                         ksocknal_next_tx_carrier(conn);
00212                 }
00213 
00214                 return 1;
00215         }
00216 
00217         /* takes two or more cookies already */
00218 
00219         if (tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] > tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1]) {
00220                 __u64   tmp = 0;
00221 
00222                 /* two separated cookies: (a+2, a) or (a+1, a) */
00223                 LASSERT (tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] -
00224                          tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] <= 2);
00225 
00226                 if (tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] -
00227                     tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] == 2) {
00228                         if (cookie == tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] + 1)
00229                                 tmp = cookie;
00230                 } else if (cookie == tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] - 1) {
00231                         tmp = tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1];
00232                 } else if (cookie == tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] + 1) {
00233                         tmp = tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0];
00234                 }
00235 
00236                 if (tmp != 0) {
00237                         /* range of cookies */
00238                         tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] = tmp - 1;
00239                         tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] = tmp + 1;
00240                         return 1;
00241                 }
00242 
00243         } else {
00244                 /* ksm_zc_cookies[0] < ksm_zc_cookies[1], it is range of cookies */
00245                 if (cookie >= tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] &&
00246                     cookie <= tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1]) {
00247                         CWARN("%s: duplicated ZC cookie: "LPU64"\n",
00248                               libcfs_id2str(conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id), cookie);
00249                         return 1; /* XXX: return error in the future */
00250                 }
00251 
00252                 if (cookie == tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] + 1) {
00253                         tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[1] = cookie;
00254                         return 1;
00255                 }
00256 
00257                 if (cookie == tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] - 1) {
00258                         tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] = cookie;
00259                         return 1;
00260                 }
00261         }
00262 
00263         /* failed to piggyback ZC-ACK */
00264         if (tx_ack != NULL) {
00265                 list_add_tail(&tx_ack->tx_list, &conn->ksnc_tx_queue);
00266                 /* the next tx can piggyback at least 1 ACK */
00267                 ksocknal_next_tx_carrier(conn);
00268         }
00269 
00270         return 0;
00271 }
00272 
00273 static int
00274 ksocknal_match_tx(ksock_conn_t *conn, ksock_tx_t *tx, int nonblk)
00275 {
00276         int nob;
00277 
00278 #if SOCKNAL_VERSION_DEBUG
00279         if (!*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_typed_conns)
00280                 return SOCKNAL_MATCH_YES;
00281 #endif
00282 
00283         if (tx == NULL || tx->tx_lnetmsg == NULL) {
00284                 /* noop packet */
00285                 nob = offsetof(ksock_msg_t, ksm_u);
00286         } else {
00287                 nob = tx->tx_lnetmsg->msg_len +
00288                       ((conn->ksnc_proto == &ksocknal_protocol_v1x) ?
00289                        sizeof(lnet_hdr_t) : sizeof(ksock_msg_t));
00290         }
00291 
00292         /* default checking for typed connection */
00293         switch (conn->ksnc_type) {
00294         default:
00295                 CERROR("ksnc_type bad: %u\n", conn->ksnc_type);
00296                 LBUG();
00297         case SOCKLND_CONN_ANY:
00298                 return SOCKNAL_MATCH_YES;
00299 
00300         case SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_IN:
00301                 return SOCKNAL_MATCH_MAY;
00302 
00303         case SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_OUT:
00304                 if (nob < *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_min_bulk)
00305                         return SOCKNAL_MATCH_MAY;
00306                 else
00307                         return SOCKNAL_MATCH_YES;
00308 
00309         case SOCKLND_CONN_CONTROL:
00310                 if (nob >= *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_min_bulk)
00311                         return SOCKNAL_MATCH_MAY;
00312                 else
00313                         return SOCKNAL_MATCH_YES;
00314         }
00315 }
00316 
00317 static int
00318 ksocknal_match_tx_v3(ksock_conn_t *conn, ksock_tx_t *tx, int nonblk)
00319 {
00320         int nob;
00321 
00322         if (tx == NULL || tx->tx_lnetmsg == NULL)
00323                 nob = offsetof(ksock_msg_t, ksm_u);
00324         else
00325                 nob = tx->tx_lnetmsg->msg_len + sizeof(ksock_msg_t);
00326 
00327         switch (conn->ksnc_type) {
00328         default:
00329                 CERROR("ksnc_type bad: %u\n", conn->ksnc_type);
00330                 LBUG();
00331         case SOCKLND_CONN_ANY:
00332                 return SOCKNAL_MATCH_NO;
00333 
00334         case SOCKLND_CONN_ACK:
00335                 if (nonblk)
00336                         return SOCKNAL_MATCH_YES;
00337                 else if (tx == NULL || tx->tx_lnetmsg == NULL)
00338                         return SOCKNAL_MATCH_MAY;
00339                 else
00340                         return SOCKNAL_MATCH_NO;
00341 
00342         case SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_OUT:
00343                 if (nonblk)
00344                         return SOCKNAL_MATCH_NO;
00345                 else if (nob < *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_min_bulk)
00346                         return SOCKNAL_MATCH_MAY;
00347                 else
00348                         return SOCKNAL_MATCH_YES;
00349 
00350         case SOCKLND_CONN_CONTROL:
00351                 if (nonblk)
00352                         return SOCKNAL_MATCH_NO;
00353                 else if (nob >= *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_min_bulk)
00354                         return SOCKNAL_MATCH_MAY;
00355                 else
00356                         return SOCKNAL_MATCH_YES;
00357         }
00358 }
00359 
00360 /* (Sink) handle incoming ZC request from sender */
00361 static int
00362 ksocknal_handle_zcreq(ksock_conn_t *c, __u64 cookie, int remote)
00363 {
00364         ksock_peer_t   *peer = c->ksnc_peer;
00365         ksock_conn_t   *conn;
00366         ksock_tx_t     *tx;
00367         int             rc;
00368 
00369         read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00370 
00371         conn = ksocknal_find_conn_locked(peer, NULL, !!remote);
00372         if (conn != NULL) {
00373                 ksock_sched_t *sched = conn->ksnc_scheduler;
00374 
00375                 LASSERT(conn->ksnc_proto->pro_queue_tx_zcack != NULL);
00376 
00377                 spin_lock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
00378 
00379                 rc = conn->ksnc_proto->pro_queue_tx_zcack(conn, NULL, cookie);
00380 
00381                 spin_unlock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
00382 
00383                 if (rc) { /* piggybacked */
00384                         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00385                         return 0;
00386                 }
00387         }
00388 
00389         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00390 
00391         /* ACK connection is not ready, or can't piggyback the ACK */
00392         tx = ksocknal_alloc_tx_noop(cookie, !!remote);
00393         if (tx == NULL)
00394                 return -ENOMEM;
00395 
00396         if ((rc = ksocknal_launch_packet(peer->ksnp_ni, tx, peer->ksnp_id)) == 0)
00397                 return 0;
00398 
00399         ksocknal_free_tx(tx);
00400         return rc;
00401 }
00402 
00403 /* (Sender) handle ZC_ACK from sink */
00404 static int
00405 ksocknal_handle_zcack(ksock_conn_t *conn, __u64 cookie1, __u64 cookie2)
00406 {
00407         ksock_peer_t      *peer = conn->ksnc_peer;
00408         ksock_tx_t        *tx;
00409         ksock_tx_t        *tmp;
00410         struct list_head        zlist = LIST_HEAD_INIT(zlist);
00411         int                count;
00412 
00413         if (cookie1 == 0)
00414                 cookie1 = cookie2;
00415 
00416         count = (cookie1 > cookie2) ? 2 : (cookie2 - cookie1 + 1);
00417 
00418         if (cookie2 == SOCKNAL_KEEPALIVE_PING &&
00419             conn->ksnc_proto == &ksocknal_protocol_v3x) {
00420                 /* keepalive PING for V3.x, just ignore it */
00421                 return count == 1 ? 0 : -EPROTO;
00422         }
00423 
00424         spin_lock(&peer->ksnp_lock);
00425 
00426         list_for_each_entry_safe(tx, tmp,
00427                                      &peer->ksnp_zc_req_list, tx_zc_list) {
00428                 __u64 c = tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0];
00429 
00430                 if (c == cookie1 || c == cookie2 || (cookie1 < c && c < cookie2)) {
00431                         tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] = 0;
00432                         list_del(&tx->tx_zc_list);
00433                         list_add(&tx->tx_zc_list, &zlist);
00434 
00435                         if (--count == 0)
00436                                 break;
00437                 }
00438         }
00439 
00440         spin_unlock(&peer->ksnp_lock);
00441 
00442         while (!list_empty(&zlist)) {
00443                 tx = list_entry(zlist.next, ksock_tx_t, tx_zc_list);
00444                 list_del(&tx->tx_zc_list);
00445                 ksocknal_tx_decref(tx);
00446         }
00447 
00448         return count == 0 ? 0 : -EPROTO;
00449 }
00450 
00451 static int
00452 ksocknal_send_hello_v1 (ksock_conn_t *conn, ksock_hello_msg_t *hello)
00453 {
00454         struct socket        *sock = conn->ksnc_sock;
00455         lnet_hdr_t          *hdr;
00456         lnet_magicversion_t *hmv;
00457         int                  rc;
00458         int                  i;
00459 
00460         CLASSERT(sizeof(lnet_magicversion_t) == offsetof(lnet_hdr_t, src_nid));
00461 
00462         LIBCFS_ALLOC(hdr, sizeof(*hdr));
00463         if (hdr == NULL) {
00464                 CERROR("Can't allocate lnet_hdr_t\n");
00465                 return -ENOMEM;
00466         }
00467 
00468         hmv = (lnet_magicversion_t *)&hdr->dest_nid;
00469 
00470         /* Re-organize V2.x message header to V1.x (lnet_hdr_t)
00471          * header and send out */
00472         hmv->magic         = cpu_to_le32 (LNET_PROTO_TCP_MAGIC);
00473         hmv->version_major = cpu_to_le16 (KSOCK_PROTO_V1_MAJOR);
00474         hmv->version_minor = cpu_to_le16 (KSOCK_PROTO_V1_MINOR);
00475 
00476         if (the_lnet.ln_testprotocompat != 0) {
00477                 /* single-shot proto check */
00478                 LNET_LOCK();
00479                 if ((the_lnet.ln_testprotocompat & 1) != 0) {
00480                         hmv->version_major++;   /* just different! */
00481                         the_lnet.ln_testprotocompat &= ~1;
00482                 }
00483                 if ((the_lnet.ln_testprotocompat & 2) != 0) {
00484                         hmv->magic = LNET_PROTO_MAGIC;
00485                         the_lnet.ln_testprotocompat &= ~2;
00486                 }
00487                 LNET_UNLOCK();
00488         }
00489 
00490         hdr->src_nid        = cpu_to_le64 (hello->kshm_src_nid);
00491         hdr->src_pid        = cpu_to_le32 (hello->kshm_src_pid);
00492         hdr->type           = cpu_to_le32 (LNET_MSG_HELLO);
00493         hdr->payload_length = cpu_to_le32 (hello->kshm_nips * sizeof(__u32));
00494         hdr->msg.hello.type = cpu_to_le32 (hello->kshm_ctype);
00495         hdr->msg.hello.incarnation = cpu_to_le64 (hello->kshm_src_incarnation);
00496 
00497         rc = lnet_sock_write(sock, hdr, sizeof(*hdr), lnet_acceptor_timeout());
00498         if (rc != 0) {
00499                 CNETERR("Error %d sending HELLO hdr to %pI4h/%d\n",
00500                         rc, &conn->ksnc_ipaddr, conn->ksnc_port);
00501                 goto out;
00502         }
00503 
00504         if (hello->kshm_nips == 0)
00505                 goto out;
00506 
00507         for (i = 0; i < (int) hello->kshm_nips; i++) {
00508                 hello->kshm_ips[i] = __cpu_to_le32 (hello->kshm_ips[i]);
00509         }
00510 
00511         rc = lnet_sock_write(sock, hello->kshm_ips,
00512                                hello->kshm_nips * sizeof(__u32),
00513                                lnet_acceptor_timeout());
00514         if (rc != 0) {
00515                 CNETERR("Error %d sending HELLO payload (%d)"
00516                         " to %pI4h/%d\n", rc, hello->kshm_nips,
00517                         &conn->ksnc_ipaddr, conn->ksnc_port);
00518         }
00519 out:
00520         LIBCFS_FREE(hdr, sizeof(*hdr));
00521 
00522         return rc;
00523 }
00524 
00525 static int
00526 ksocknal_send_hello_v2 (ksock_conn_t *conn, ksock_hello_msg_t *hello)
00527 {
00528         struct socket   *sock = conn->ksnc_sock;
00529         int             rc;
00530 
00531         hello->kshm_magic   = LNET_PROTO_MAGIC;
00532         hello->kshm_version = conn->ksnc_proto->pro_version;
00533 
00534         if (the_lnet.ln_testprotocompat != 0) {
00535                 /* single-shot proto check */
00536                 LNET_LOCK();
00537                 if ((the_lnet.ln_testprotocompat & 1) != 0) {
00538                         hello->kshm_version++;   /* just different! */
00539                         the_lnet.ln_testprotocompat &= ~1;
00540                 }
00541                 LNET_UNLOCK();
00542         }
00543 
00544         rc = lnet_sock_write(sock, hello, offsetof(ksock_hello_msg_t, kshm_ips),
00545                                lnet_acceptor_timeout());
00546 
00547         if (rc != 0) {
00548                 CNETERR("Error %d sending HELLO hdr to %pI4h/%d\n",
00549                         rc, &conn->ksnc_ipaddr, conn->ksnc_port);
00550                 return rc;
00551         }
00552 
00553         if (hello->kshm_nips == 0)
00554                 return 0;
00555 
00556         rc = lnet_sock_write(sock, hello->kshm_ips,
00557                                hello->kshm_nips * sizeof(__u32),
00558                                lnet_acceptor_timeout());
00559         if (rc != 0) {
00560                 CNETERR("Error %d sending HELLO payload (%d)"
00561                         " to %pI4h/%d\n", rc, hello->kshm_nips,
00562                         &conn->ksnc_ipaddr, conn->ksnc_port);
00563         }
00564 
00565         return rc;
00566 }
00567 
00568 static int
00569 ksocknal_recv_hello_v1(ksock_conn_t *conn, ksock_hello_msg_t *hello,int timeout)
00570 {
00571         struct socket        *sock = conn->ksnc_sock;
00572         lnet_hdr_t          *hdr;
00573         int                  rc;
00574         int                  i;
00575 
00576         LIBCFS_ALLOC(hdr, sizeof(*hdr));
00577         if (hdr == NULL) {
00578                 CERROR("Can't allocate lnet_hdr_t\n");
00579                 return -ENOMEM;
00580         }
00581 
00582         rc = lnet_sock_read(sock, &hdr->src_nid,
00583                               sizeof(*hdr) - offsetof(lnet_hdr_t, src_nid),
00584                               timeout);
00585         if (rc != 0) {
00586                 CERROR("Error %d reading rest of HELLO hdr from %pI4h\n",
00587                        rc, &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
00588                 LASSERT(rc < 0 && rc != -EALREADY);
00589                 goto out;
00590         }
00591 
00592         /* ...and check we got what we expected */
00593         if (hdr->type != cpu_to_le32 (LNET_MSG_HELLO)) {
00594                 CERROR ("Expecting a HELLO hdr,"
00595                         " but got type %d from %pI4h\n",
00596                         le32_to_cpu (hdr->type),
00597                         &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
00598                 rc = -EPROTO;
00599                 goto out;
00600         }
00601 
00602         hello->kshm_src_nid         = le64_to_cpu (hdr->src_nid);
00603         hello->kshm_src_pid         = le32_to_cpu (hdr->src_pid);
00604         hello->kshm_src_incarnation = le64_to_cpu (hdr->msg.hello.incarnation);
00605         hello->kshm_ctype           = le32_to_cpu (hdr->msg.hello.type);
00606         hello->kshm_nips            = le32_to_cpu (hdr->payload_length) /
00607                                          sizeof (__u32);
00608 
00609         if (hello->kshm_nips > LNET_MAX_INTERFACES) {
00610                 CERROR("Bad nips %d from ip %pI4h\n",
00611                        hello->kshm_nips, &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
00612                 rc = -EPROTO;
00613                 goto out;
00614         }
00615 
00616         if (hello->kshm_nips == 0)
00617                 goto out;
00618 
00619         rc = lnet_sock_read(sock, hello->kshm_ips,
00620                               hello->kshm_nips * sizeof(__u32), timeout);
00621         if (rc != 0) {
00622                 CERROR("Error %d reading IPs from ip %pI4h\n",
00623                        rc, &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
00624                 LASSERT(rc < 0 && rc != -EALREADY);
00625                 goto out;
00626         }
00627 
00628         for (i = 0; i < (int) hello->kshm_nips; i++) {
00629                 hello->kshm_ips[i] = __le32_to_cpu(hello->kshm_ips[i]);
00630 
00631                 if (hello->kshm_ips[i] == 0) {
00632                         CERROR("Zero IP[%d] from ip %pI4h\n",
00633                                i, &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
00634                         rc = -EPROTO;
00635                         break;
00636                 }
00637         }
00638 out:
00639         LIBCFS_FREE(hdr, sizeof(*hdr));
00640 
00641         return rc;
00642 }
00643 
00644 static int
00645 ksocknal_recv_hello_v2(ksock_conn_t *conn, ksock_hello_msg_t *hello,
00646                        int timeout)
00647 {
00648         struct socket     *sock = conn->ksnc_sock;
00649         int                rc;
00650         int                i;
00651 
00652         if (hello->kshm_magic == LNET_PROTO_MAGIC)
00653                 conn->ksnc_flip = 0;
00654         else
00655                 conn->ksnc_flip = 1;
00656 
00657         rc = lnet_sock_read(sock, &hello->kshm_src_nid,
00658                               offsetof(ksock_hello_msg_t, kshm_ips) -
00659                                        offsetof(ksock_hello_msg_t, kshm_src_nid),
00660                               timeout);
00661         if (rc != 0) {
00662                 CERROR("Error %d reading HELLO from %pI4h\n",
00663                        rc, &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
00664                 LASSERT(rc < 0 && rc != -EALREADY);
00665                 return rc;
00666         }
00667 
00668         if (conn->ksnc_flip) {
00669                 __swab32s(&hello->kshm_src_pid);
00670                 __swab64s(&hello->kshm_src_nid);
00671                 __swab32s(&hello->kshm_dst_pid);
00672                 __swab64s(&hello->kshm_dst_nid);
00673                 __swab64s(&hello->kshm_src_incarnation);
00674                 __swab64s(&hello->kshm_dst_incarnation);
00675                 __swab32s(&hello->kshm_ctype);
00676                 __swab32s(&hello->kshm_nips);
00677         }
00678 
00679         if (hello->kshm_nips > LNET_MAX_INTERFACES) {
00680                 CERROR("Bad nips %d from ip %pI4h\n",
00681                        hello->kshm_nips, &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
00682                 return -EPROTO;
00683         }
00684 
00685         if (hello->kshm_nips == 0)
00686                 return 0;
00687 
00688         rc = lnet_sock_read(sock, hello->kshm_ips,
00689                             hello->kshm_nips * sizeof(__u32), timeout);
00690         if (rc != 0) {
00691                 CERROR("Error %d reading IPs from ip %pI4h\n",
00692                        rc, &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
00693                 LASSERT(rc < 0 && rc != -EALREADY);
00694                 return rc;
00695         }
00696 
00697         for (i = 0; i < (int) hello->kshm_nips; i++) {
00698                 if (conn->ksnc_flip)
00699                         __swab32s(&hello->kshm_ips[i]);
00700 
00701                 if (hello->kshm_ips[i] == 0) {
00702                         CERROR("Zero IP[%d] from ip %pI4h\n",
00703                                i, &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
00704                         return -EPROTO;
00705                 }
00706         }
00707 
00708         return 0;
00709 }
00710 
00711 static void
00712 ksocknal_pack_msg_v1(ksock_tx_t *tx)
00713 {
00714         /* V1.x has no KSOCK_MSG_NOOP */
00715         LASSERT(tx->tx_msg.ksm_type != KSOCK_MSG_NOOP);
00716         LASSERT(tx->tx_lnetmsg != NULL);
00717 
00718         tx->tx_iov[0].iov_base = (void *)&tx->tx_lnetmsg->msg_hdr;
00719         tx->tx_iov[0].iov_len  = sizeof(lnet_hdr_t);
00720 
00721         tx->tx_resid = tx->tx_nob = tx->tx_lnetmsg->msg_len + sizeof(lnet_hdr_t);
00722 }
00723 
00724 static void
00725 ksocknal_pack_msg_v2(ksock_tx_t *tx)
00726 {
00727         tx->tx_iov[0].iov_base = (void *)&tx->tx_msg;
00728 
00729         if (tx->tx_lnetmsg != NULL) {
00730                 LASSERT(tx->tx_msg.ksm_type != KSOCK_MSG_NOOP);
00731 
00732                 tx->tx_msg.ksm_u.lnetmsg.ksnm_hdr = tx->tx_lnetmsg->msg_hdr;
00733                 tx->tx_iov[0].iov_len = sizeof(ksock_msg_t);
00734                 tx->tx_resid = tx->tx_nob = sizeof(ksock_msg_t) + tx->tx_lnetmsg->msg_len;
00735         } else {
00736                 LASSERT(tx->tx_msg.ksm_type == KSOCK_MSG_NOOP);
00737 
00738                 tx->tx_iov[0].iov_len = offsetof(ksock_msg_t, ksm_u.lnetmsg.ksnm_hdr);
00739                 tx->tx_resid = tx->tx_nob = offsetof(ksock_msg_t,  ksm_u.lnetmsg.ksnm_hdr);
00740         }
00741         /* Don't checksum before start sending, because packet can be piggybacked with ACK */
00742 }
00743 
00744 static void
00745 ksocknal_unpack_msg_v1(ksock_msg_t *msg)
00746 {
00747         msg->ksm_csum           = 0;
00748         msg->ksm_type           = KSOCK_MSG_LNET;
00749         msg->ksm_zc_cookies[0]  = msg->ksm_zc_cookies[1]  = 0;
00750 }
00751 
00752 static void
00753 ksocknal_unpack_msg_v2(ksock_msg_t *msg)
00754 {
00755         return;  /* Do nothing */
00756 }
00757 
00758 ksock_proto_t  ksocknal_protocol_v1x =
00759 {
00760         .pro_version            = KSOCK_PROTO_V1,
00761         .pro_send_hello         = ksocknal_send_hello_v1,
00762         .pro_recv_hello         = ksocknal_recv_hello_v1,
00763         .pro_pack               = ksocknal_pack_msg_v1,
00764         .pro_unpack             = ksocknal_unpack_msg_v1,
00765         .pro_queue_tx_msg       = ksocknal_queue_tx_msg_v1,
00766         .pro_handle_zcreq       = NULL,
00767         .pro_handle_zcack       = NULL,
00768         .pro_queue_tx_zcack     = NULL,
00769         .pro_match_tx           = ksocknal_match_tx
00770 };

00776         .pro_recv_hello         = ksocknal_recv_hello_v2,
00777         .pro_pack               = ksocknal_pack_msg_v2,
00778         .pro_unpack             = ksocknal_unpack_msg_v2,
00779         .pro_queue_tx_msg       = ksocknal_queue_tx_msg_v2,
00780         .pro_queue_tx_zcack     = ksocknal_queue_tx_zcack_v2,
00781         .pro_handle_zcreq       = ksocknal_handle_zcreq,
00782         .pro_handle_zcack       = ksocknal_handle_zcack,
00783         .pro_match_tx           = ksocknal_match_tx
00784 };
